content:
Hi Dragon,
Is your team planning on enhancing the eCR Now application so that it can submit an eCR (ITI-41) with a SAML section so that it will be compatible with the eHealth Exchange specification for document submission? I know there was talk of integrating CONNECT with eCR Now for this purpose but I'm not sure if you would package CONNECT with eCR Now? If a package with CONNECT is the approach, maybe Docker could be used to bundle the two?
For reference, the eHealth Exchange specification: https://s3.amazonaws.com/seqprojectehex/wp-content/uploads/2018/09/28215240/nhin-document-submission-production-specification-v2-0-a.pdf
Thanks,
Mike

Mike we are still discussing the best options for ITI-41 support, we may provide some kind of an API that can be integrated with health systems rather than actually packaging CONNECT with the app. Your thoughts are welcome and more discussion is needed to solidify the approach.
Thanks Dragon. Can you elaborate about the API. The API would integrate into the EHR health systems so that the eCR submission could be sent through the EHR instead of sent/transmitted by eCR Now?
And if so, I like the idea of the API.
